page.title: 01BACKGROUND
page.content: {CHARLTON MACKRELL}and{CHARLTON ADAM are situated in the county of SOMERSET.Together they form the civil parish of Charlton Mackrell,which is part of the{SOMERTON AND FROME Parliamentary Constituency. The population of the combined villages is almost one thousand.This is almost double that of twenty years ago;this is due to the coming of mains drainage when more council houses and private houses were built. Most land is used for farming but there are also two quarries for local limestone. There is a church in each village. There are two shops and two public houses.The shops are both General stores.Charlton Adam shop is also a sub-Post Office. There is a Church of England Primary School for children between the ages of 4 -11yrs.
